permanentBaleIdentification.title: Permament Bale Identification (PBI)
permanentBaleIdentification.description: A bar-coded bale identification tag, preprinted with the gin code number and gin bale number (individually referenced below), that is placed between the two halves of the sample for identification purposes.  The Permanent Bale Identification (PBI) tag gives each bale a unique 12-digit number that is not repeated within a five year period.

ginCodeNumber.title: Gin Code Number
ginCodeNumber.description: A number that composes the first five digits of the PBI. The first two digits denote the Classing Office, and the last three digits identify the gin. The local Classing Office assigns this code number.

ginBaleNumber.title: Gin Bale Number
ginBaleNumber.description: A number that composes the last seven-digits of the PBI and is assigned by the gin.

classificationDate.title: Classification Date
classificationDate.description: Describes the date of classification of the cotton sample.

classedDate.title: Date Classed
classedDate.description: The date the classification data for the bale was released by the Classing Office.

cropYear.title: Crop Year
cropYear.description: The crop year of the cotton sample.

baleReceiving.title: Bale Receiving
baleReceiving.description: Describes how the sample was received and the module or trailer identification associated with it.

receivingType.title: Receiving Type
receivingType.description: A one-digit code that indicates whether the sample was outturned as a single bale or as a bale that was module or trailer averaged. The codes are described as follows: 0 = Single Bale, 1 = Module, 2 = Trailer

moduleTrailerNumber.title: Module/Trailer Number
moduleTrailerNumber.description: A five-digit number that identifies the module/trailer number assigned at the gin.

baleCount.title: Bale Count
baleCount.description: The number of bales in the module/trailer that were released with the module average calculations.

baleClassing.title: Bale Classing
baleClassing.description: Describes the classification data of the sample.

colorGrading.title: Color Grading
colorGrading.description: Describes how the color of the sample is defined.

officialColorGrade.title: Official Color Grade
officialColorGrade.description: The two-digit official Upland or Pima color grade that appears on the classification record that is determined by instrument based measurements of Rd and +b. Color grades between 11-85 refer to Upland cotton and color grades between 1-7 refer to Pima cotton. Certain special condition codes may replace the instrument based measurement for color grade in the Official Color Grade columns if manually identified by a cotton classer. These codes are as follows: Pima Cotton: 93 - Mixture of Pima and Upland, 94 - Fire Damaged, 95 - Water Damaged. Upland Cotton: 96 - Mixture of Upland and Pima, 97 - Fire Damaged, 98 - Water Damaged

instrumentColorGrade.title: Instrument Color Grade
instrumentColorGrade.description: The two-digit color grade that is used to determine the offical color grade for Upland or Pima cotton unless superseded by a special condition code.

colorQuadrant.title: Color Quadrant
colorQuadrant.description: The color quadrant, according to USDA color diagrams.

colorRd.title: Color Rd
colorRd.description: Measurement of the grayness of the sample, reported to the nearest 10th. Grayness indicates how light or dark the sample is.

colorPlusB.title: Color +b
colorPlusB.description: Measurement of the yellowness of the sample, reported to the nearest 10th.

stapleLength.title: Staple Length
stapleLength.description: Describes the length of the cotton staple.

length32.title: Length in 32nds of an Inch
length32.description: Staple length measured in 32nds of an inch.

length100.title: Length in 100ths of an Inch
length100.description: Staple length measured in 100ths of an inch.

micronaire.title: Micronaire
micronaire.description: Micronaire is a measure of the cotton’s fineness and is determined by measuring the cotton's resistance to air flow per unit mass. It is reported to the nearest 10th.

strength.title: Strength
strength.description: Describes the fiber strength of the sample. It is reported as the force in grams required to break a bundle of fibers one tex unit in size.

leafGrade.title: Leaf Grade
leafGrade.description: A one-digit grade that refers to the measurement of the cotton plant’s leaf particles that remain in the lint after the ginning process. Upland leaf grades are identified as numbers 1-8 where leaf grade 8 is considered below grade, meaning it is identified as having more leaf than leaf grade 7. Pima leaf grades are identified as numbers 1-7 where leaf grade 7 is considered below grade.

extraneousMatter.title: Extraneous Matter
extraneousMatter.description: A two-digit code that describes any substance in the cotton other than fiber or leaf and is determined by the classer. Extraneous matter is reported as level 1 or level 2, with level 2 indicating the heavier contamination. The code numbers are described as follows: 01 - Prep Level 1, 02 - Prep Level 2, 11 - Bark Level 1, 12 - Bark Level 2, 21 - Grass Level 1, 22 - Grass Level 2, 31 - Seed Coat Fragments Level 1, 32 - Seed Coat Fragments Level 2, 41 - Oil Level 1, 42 - Oil Level 2, 51 - Spindle Twist Level 1, 52 - Spindle Twist Level 2, 61 - Other Level 1, 62 - Other Level 2, 71 - Plastic Level 1, 72 - Plastic Level 2

remarks.title: Remarks
remarks.description: A two-digit code that classers assign when special conditions may cause processing problems and lower yarn quality. The instrument assigns the remark code 75 where applicable. The special condition codes are defined as follows: 75 - Other Side Two or More Color Grades and/or Color Groups or One Color Grade and One Color Group Higher, 76 - Reginned, 77 - Repacked, 78 - Redder Than Normal (Pima), 92 - Pima Ginned on Saw Gin

trashPercentArea.title: Trash Percent Area
trashPercentArea.description: The percent of the sample surface covered by trash particles as determined by the instrument to the nearest tenth. Trash particles include extraneous matter such as grass, bark, etc., but these particles cannot be distinguished one from another by this measurement.

lengthUniformityIndex.title: Length Uniformity Index
lengthUniformityIndex.description: Measurement of the degree of uniformity of the fibers in a sample to the nearest tenth, described as a percent.

cottonType.title: Upland or Pima Cotton
cottonType.description: A one-digit code that indicates whether the sample is Upland or American Pima, with 1 being Upland and 2 being Pima.

recordType.title: Record Type
recordType.description: A one digit code that indicates the type of record, as follows: 0 - Original, 1 - Review, 2 - Rework

recordStatus.title: Record Status
recordStatus.description: A one-digit code that indicates whether or not the manual classing information has been corrected, with 0 indicating not a correction and 1 indicating a correction.

cccLoanPoints.title: CCC Loan Premiums and Discounts
cccLoanPoints.description: A five-digit code that gives the CCC loan premium and discount points for the cotton. For Upland cotton, a positive value indicates a premium while a negative value indicates a discount. The physical loan price for Pima cotton is shown in cents per pound.
